meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7713.

td.p: Lane Flynn, a business owner from Atlanta, Georgia
Emily Perez, a graduate student of library science from Wappingers Falls, New York
Jack Rice, a marketing associate from Portland, Oregon (whose 1-day cash winnings total $26,500)

tr.td: HUMANS IN THE GALAPAGOS
ANIMATED DISNEY FILM BY VILLAIN
ABBREVIATED MAGAZINES
SPRING MEDLEY
SUFFRAGETTE CITY
FISHING FOR COMPLIMENTS

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'Moby-Dick

Lane
')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '(Alex presents the clue from the Galapagos.) One of the most famous ships to visit the Galapagos Islands was a whaling vessel called the Essex; shortly after leaving this island of Floreana, it was attacked and destroyed by a sperm whale--hm, the inspiration for this 1851 novel?')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Alex presents the clue from the Galapagos.) One of the most famous ships to visit the Galapagos Islands was a whaling vessel called the Essex; shortly after leaving this island of Floreana, it was attacked and destroyed by a sperm whale--hm, the inspiration for this 1851 novel?

toggle('clue_J_1_5', 'clue_J_1_5_stuck', '(Alex: And before we move on, I want to thank Lindblad Expeditions for making that trip such an enjoyable one for me. And also thanks to the crew aboard the National Geographic Endeavour II for all of their great work. We have less than a minute to go now.)

the War of 1812

Emily
')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_5', 'clue_J_1_5_stuck', '(Alex presents the clue from the Galapagos.) I\'m at Post Office Bay on the island of Floreana--when sailors\' messages to their families back home were intercepted right here by U.S. Navy captain David Porter & his crew, they indicated the positions of their ships, & that information helped destroy the British Pacific whaling fleet during this war')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Alex presents the clue from the Galapagos.) I'm at Post Office Bay on the island of Floreana--when sailors' messages to their families back home were intercepted right here by U.S. Navy captain David Porter & his crew, they indicated the positions of their ships, & that information helped destroy the British Pacific whaling fleet during this war
